thread.title: MS Masters leads Cebu by 2
thread.title_full: MS Masters leads Cebu by 2 | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Rey Bancod
title: MS Masters leads Cebu by 2
text:
by Rey Bancod
October 9, 2015 Bacolod City — Defending champion Manila Southwoods Masters drew a pair of 52 points from its youngest players, but failed to shake off Cebu Country Club in the 10th Philippine Airlines Ladies Interclub golf team championships Friday at the Negros Occidental Golf and Country Club (NOGCC).
Only two points separate the fierce rivals going into the final round Saturday.
Lois Kaye Go led Cebu Country Club’s assault by shooting the day’s best of even par 72 – equivalent to 54 Molave points – in the second day of the PAL Ladies Interclub at the Marapara golf course in Bacolod. (Courtesy of PAL)
Southwoods Masters leaned on Sofia Chabon, 14, and Missy Legaspi, 13, to finish the day with 278 points.
Chabon, who teed off in the back nine, bogeyed the first three holes, but settled down with three birdies against two more bogeys.
Legaspi, younger sister of Southeast Asian Games player Miya, matched Chabon’s 52 with two birdies against four bogeys.
Sixteen-year-old Abby Arevalo, struggling off the tee, added 49 points on three birdies against six bogeys and a double bogey.
Rounding out the Masters’ scoring were Loralie Roberto 48, Kim Yong Mi 39 and Annika Guangko 38.
Southwoods captain Marie Claire Ong, who did not count with 30 points, said the course played very long.
“The course condition was hard today,” she said.
Claudine Garcia was the only other Masters player whose 34 was not counted.
CCC leaned on Lois Kaye Go and Crystal Faith Neri to keep Masters within arm’s length with 276 points.
Go, a 16-year-old graduating student of Centre for International Education, shot the day’s best score of even par 72, equivalent to 54 Molave points.
Go, who is set to enter Boston College next year, played flawlessly in the last nine holes, adding two birdies to offset back-to-back bogeys from the 15th hole.
“I played pretty solid today. I missed only five greens,” said Go.
Neri, a new addition to CCC, fired two birdies against four bogeys and a double bogey for 50 points.
“We’re very happy to hold Southwoods at bay. Frankly, we did not expect to stay in contention,” said CCC skipper Mary Kim Hong who contributed 48 points.
Except for Junia Gabasa, who struggled with 45 points, Hong said her teammates played according to expectations.
Other CCC scorers were Riko Nagai 42 and Ryoko Nagai 35. Failing to count were Menchit Martinez (28) and Josephine Siguan (27).
In the Friendship division, Lady Eagles Australia collected 227 points to lead Davao Golf by 27 points. Scoring for the lone foreign team were Mia Marjorie Martin 46, Zoe Ann Ticehurst 45, Jessica Widarma 45, Precila Keogh 37, Ella Xigin Wong 27 and Jasmine Driscoll 27.
Davao Golf drew 200 points from Rosalie Antivo 37, Virgie Hermiston 37, Evelyn Quinsay 37, Stella Barnes 35, Josephine Vergara 28 and JM Balbuena 26.
